body:
_find_library_dirs_ldconfig was added in https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3245.

@pslacerda, please could you check it?

issue.title: Release Pillow 5.4.0 on January 1, 2019
issue.body:
Need release notes:
* [x] https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3406: Done in https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3451

## Main release checklist

* [x] Open a release ticket
* [x] Develop and prepare release in ``master`` branch.
* [x] Check [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/python-pillow/Pillow) and [AppVeyor CI](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/python-pillow/Pillow) to confirm passing tests in ``master`` branch.
* [x] Check that all of the wheel builds [Pillow Wheel Builder](https://github.com/python-pillow/pillow-wheels) pass the tests in Travis CI.
* [x] In compliance with [PEP 440](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/), update version identifier in `src/PIL/_version.py`
* [x] Update `CHANGES.rst`.
* [x] Run pre-release check via `make release-test` in a freshly cloned repo.
* [x] Create branch and tag for release e.g.:
```
    $ git branch 5.4.x
    $ git tag 5.4.0
    $ git push --all
    $ git push --tags
```
* [x] Create source distributions e.g.:
```
    $ make sdist
```
* [x] Create [binary distributions](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/blob/master/RELEASING.md#binary-distributions)
* [x] Upload all binaries and source distributions e.g. ``twine upload dist/Pillow-5.4.0-*``
* [x] Create a [new release on GitHub](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/releases/new)
* [x] In compliance with [PEP 440](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/), append `.dev0` to version identifier in `src/PIL/_version.py`

## Binary Distributions

### Windows
* [x] Contact `@cgohlke` for Windows binaries via release ticket e.g. https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/1174.
* [x] Download and extract tarball from `@cgohlke` and ``twine upload *``.

### Mac and Linux
* [x] Use the [Pillow Wheel Builder](https://github.com/python-pillow/pillow-wheels):
```
    $ git clone https://github.com/python-pillow/pillow-wheels
    $ cd pillow-wheels
    $ git submodule init
    $ git submodule update Pillow
    $ cd Pillow
    $ git fetch --all
    $ git checkout [[release tag]]
    $ cd ..
    $ git commit -m "Pillow -> 5.2.0" Pillow
    $ git push
```
* [x] Download distributions from the [Pillow Wheel Builder container](http://a365fff413fe338398b6-1c8a9b3114517dc5fe17b7c3f8c63a43.r19.cf2.rackcdn.com/).


## Publicize Release

* [x] Announce release availability via [Twitter](https://twitter.com/pythonpillow) e.g. https://twitter.com/PythonPillow/status/1013789184354603010

## Documentation

* [x] Make sure the default version for Read the Docs is the latest release version, i.e. ``5.4.0`` rather than ``latest`` e.g. https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/5.4.x/

body:
@valpogus your development environment should be very funny: Termux on Android on Linux with some hardware virtualization!

@hugovk I'm looking it right now and ping you back soon.

`_find_library_dirs_ldconfig` should return a empty list instead of `None`, so it can go through Termux/`ANDROID_ROOT` code. Or return a generator instead.

I'm worried about  `/include` for Termux (the comments talk about)  that I don't see even before the introduction of `_find_library_dirs_ldconfig`. Maybe I missed something.

issue.title: Fix build for Termux

repository.name: Pillow
repository.description: The friendly PIL fork (Python Imaging Library)

issue.body:
Now `_find_library_dirs_ldconfig` returns an empty list when `ldconfig` is missing, then `setup.py` can continue guessing library directories.

Fixes #3526.

issue.title: Fix build for Termux
issue.body:
Now `_find_library_dirs_ldconfig` returns an empty list when `ldconfig` is missing, then `setup.py` can continue guessing library directories.

Fixes #3526.

body: Initial termux support was done on a chromebook in the termux environment. It's possible that this can be tested in termux on docker.

Such a rare OS! I managed to install Pillow on #3529. It was developed on an Android phone because was simple to fix. Only `python setup.py install` was needed.

Tests on Docker seems very nice also.

issue.title: Release Pillow 5.4.1
issue.body:
Follow on from 5.4.0 (#3391).

TODO:

* Fix PNG MIME type regression: https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3501#issuecomment-450764968 / PR https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3525 (cherry pick just the PNG fix)
  * [x] Merge to master
  * [x] Cherry picked
* Fix Termux regression: https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/3526 / PR: https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3529
  * [x] Merge to master
  * [x] Cherry picked
* Fix PNG "IDAT chunks after image end" regression: #3527 / PR #3532
  * [x] Merge to master
  * [x] Cherry picked
* Fix file closing regression: https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/3536 / PR #3540
  * [x] Merge to master
  * [x] Cherry picked
* Release notes: PRs https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3544 & https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/3553
  * [x] Merge to master
  * [x] Cherry picked

## Point Release

Released as needed for security, installation or critical bug fixes.

* [x] Make necessary changes in ``master`` branch.
* [x] Update `CHANGES.rst`.
* [x] Cherry pick individual commits from ``master`` branch to release branch e.g. ``5.4.x``.
* [x] Check [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.org/python-pillow/Pillow) to confirm passing tests in release branch e.g. ``5.4.x``.
* [x] Check out release branch e.g.:
```
    git checkout -t remotes/origin/5.4.x
```
* [x] In compliance with [PEP 440](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/), update version identifier in `src/PIL/_version.py`
* [x] Run pre-release check via `make release-test`.
* [x] Create tag for release e.g.:
```
    $ git tag 5.4.1
    $ git push --tags
```
* [x] Create source distributions e.g.:
```
    $ make sdist
```
* [x] Create [binary distributions](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/blob/master/RELEASING.md#binary-distributions)
* [x] Create a [new release on GitHub](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/releases/new)

## Binary Distributions

### Windows
* [x] Contact `@cgohlke` for Windows binaries via release ticket e.g. https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/issues/1174.
* [x] Download and extract tarball from `@cgohlke` and ``twine upload *``.

### Mac and Linux
* [x] Use the [Pillow Wheel Builder](https://github.com/python-pillow/pillow-wheels):
```
    $ git clone https://github.com/python-pillow/pillow-wheels
    $ cd pillow-wheels
    $ git submodule init
    $ git submodule update Pillow
    $ cd Pillow
    $ git fetch --all
    $ git checkout [[release tag]]
    $ cd ..
    $ git commit -m "Pillow -> 5.4.1" Pillow
    $ git push
```
* [x] Download distributions from the [Pillow Wheel Builder container](http://a365fff413fe338398b6-1c8a9b3114517dc5fe17b7c3f8c63a43.r19.cf2.rackcdn.com/).


## Publicize Release

* [x] Announce release availability via [Twitter](https://twitter.com/pythonpillow) e.g. https://twitter.com/PythonPillow/status/1013789184354603010

## Documentation

* [x] Make sure the default version for Read the Docs is the latest tagged release e.g. ``d2d43879`` (5.4.1)
